content: stroller sized c2c baby blanket by fangedknight foreward this has been my personal pattern for baby blankets for years it s super easy works up quick and provides an extremely comfortable and warm blanket for our newest members of the world this blanket pattern is technically made to measure as all of my baby blankets are stroller-sized which is about 36 x 36 if you need a larger or smaller blanket please adjust your size accordingly the technique is exactly the same while you can do color changes with this project if you like i find the best results come from cakes of self-striping yarn such as caron cakes or lion brand mandala cakes self-striping yarns will create gorgeous diagonal stripes as you ve seen in the pictures for this project i ll be using lion brand mandala baby you can use any size yarn and hook you d like just please make sure to use a hook size that is appropriate for the yarn you re using i would also suggest dropping down a hook size from what the yarn label recommends for a tighter stitch/block so it holds in the warmth a little more and also gives it a wonderful texture when finished important info and materials difficulty easy terminology us abbreviations abbreviation meaning chain chain yarn over pull through loop on hook slip_stitch slip_stitch insert hook into stitch or chain 3 space yarn over pull through loop on hook double_crochet double_crochet yarn over insert hook into stitch draw up a loop yarn over pull through two loops on hook yarn over pull through final too loops on hook chain-3 space chain 3 space the space made in each block by the chain 3 that counts as the 1st double_crochet stitch in each block see photos or video *instructions inside asterisks* repeat the section inside the asterisks as instructed materials 🧶 g-6/4 25mm hook yarn recommended hook size was h-8/5 0mm 🧶 yarn i m using lion brand mandala baby dk weight 🧶 fabric tape measure 🧶 scissors 🧶 needle to weave in ends optional video tutorial there is a video tutorial for this technique which includes starting c2c crochet increasing decreasing and finishing off please click here to watch the video written instructions please note these are going to be designated as row but it helps if you think of everything in blocks every single chain 3 counts as the 1st double_crochet including the 3 chs left over from the chain 6 on an increase the purpose of this technique is to work on the diagonal in blocks each block consists of a chain 3 and 3 dcs part 1 - setup & increase row 1 chain 6 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook 3 remaining chs counts as 1st double_crochet double_crochet in 2 remaining chs 4 dcs row 2 chain 6 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook 3 remaining chs counts as 1st double_crochet double_crochet in 2 remaining chs flip up block from row 1 slip_stitch
